body: The Q train announcement was, actually, decipherable. That's not to say it was easy to comprehend. ''This train is being delayed. There is a dog on the tracks.'' That got the attention of the people in the front car yesterday. Cellphones popped open. Calls were made to work. Doubts were expressed as to whether the excuse would be accepted.
title: Wandering Canine Gives Train Riders a Tail of the City

body: When Aminisha Black moved to Clinton Hill, Brooklyn, in 1971, the Italianate villa-style house across from her brownstone on Lefferts Place was home to several aging followers of the charismatic spiritual leader Father Divine. These acolytes, Ms. Black recalled, were sweet old ladies who went by names like Miss Patience and Miss Kindness. They
title: NEIGHBORHOOD REPORT: CLINTON HILL; Storm Clouds Gather Over an Italianate Charmer

body: A Brooklyn teenager died last night after he hit his head while trying to climb a fence in front of a school in Ditmas Park, and the police said he may have been electrocuted. Luis Rivera, 17, of Rugby Road, was found unconscious shortly before 8 p.m. with head injuries in front of Public School 217 near the intersection of Newkirk and Coney Island
title: Metro Briefing | New York: Brooklyn: Teenager Dies Climbing Fence

body: The Brooklyn Waterfront Artists Coalition, based in Red Hook, operates one of the rawest exhibition spaces in New York City: a corner of the Beard Street Warehouse, an 1869 complex of storehouses built of rough-cut schist on reclaimed marshland. The galleries have no air-conditioning or heating. Light enters through arched iron shutters and bounces
title: Students Imagine Red Hook's Future

body: ''WE just unlocked the doors and wow.'' That's how Tom Kearney, the chef at the Farm on Adderley, an American restaurant on Cortelyou Road in Brooklyn, described the neighborhood's immediate and enthusiastic embrace of the place, which first unlocked its doors only a month ago. Mr. Kearney, who was the chef at Sweetwater in Williamsburg, Brooklyn,
title: $25 AND UNDER; Embracing the Country in Ditmas Park

body: OPEN NOW Pier 2110 -- This 175-seat seafood restaurant adds touches of soul and Asia to many dishes, including creamy grits with stuffed baked trout and mussels in a coconut-curry broth. The owner, Betty Park, also owns the Manna's restaurants in Harlem and Brooklyn. The chef, Jamie Blatt, worked at Bar Six: 2110 Adam Clayton Powell Jr. Boulevard
title: FOOD STUFF; OFF THE MENU

body: Reggae Concert Canceled Protests have led to the cancellation of a reggae concert scheduled for Tuesday at Webster Hall. The event, intended to raise awareness of H.I.V. and AIDS, was to have featured Beenie Man, right, and the group T.O.K., who, protesters complained, are antigay, The Associated Press reported. The protesters flooded the
title: Arts, Briefly

body: Like many of his neighbors, Emmanuel Constant left behind tumult in his homeland, Haiti, and found a more stable life in New York City. The change was good. He became a real estate agent and lived in a spacious white house in Queens. But Mr. Constant kept his nickname -- Toto -- a name that continues to stir fear and hatred among many Haitians, who
title: To His Compatriots' Relief, Haitian Exile Is Arrested

body: In the wake of spandex-clad drag queens, a slew of feather headdresses and a float themed ''Carnival in Rio,'' Jo-Ann Shain and Mary Jo Kennedy did not stand out among the gay and proud parading yesterday afternoon down Fifth Avenue. In contrast to the sequins and go-go boots donned by some marchers at the annual gay pride parade, they wore cotton
title: Despite a Daylong Drizzle, a Rainbow of Political Pride Shines at Gay Parade

body: For the last four decades, the predominantly black population of central Brooklyn has been represented in Washington by one of its own, a tradition that dates to the 1968 victory of Shirley Chisholm, the first black woman elected to Congress. But now, in a district whose boundaries were drawn to strengthen black voting power, residents are locked
title: In Shirley Chisholm's Brooklyn, Rancor Over White Candidacy

body: Two people were shot, one fatally, about 9 p.m. yesterday on a residential street in Ditmas Park, Brooklyn, the police said. A 34-year-old man was declared dead at the scene after he was shot in the head and chest in front of 520 East 21st Street. The other victim, a 36-year-old woman whom neighbors identified as Nichelle Edwards, was shot in the
title: Metro Briefing | New York: Brooklyn: Shooting Leaves One Dead

body: To the Editor: Thank you for publishing the informative question and answer on the little-publicized topic of human milk banking (''A Mother's Memory,'' F.Y.I., May 14). It was heartening to see that our foremothers, and the federal government, saw the value of breast milk for our infants. We are board-certified lactation consultants and have been
title: Bring Back The Milk Bank!

body: At his corner grocery on Coney Island Avenue in Ditmas Park, Brooklyn, Tariq Asheik minded the store alone yesterday morning, having given his two Mexican employees the day off to join rallies in support of immigrant rights. ''I love immigrants,'' said Mr. Asheik, who is from Pakistan. ''Everyone's an immigrant here.'' Along the unusually quiet
title: THE IMMIGRATION DEBATE: NEW YORK; Thousands Turn Out, But Support Is Mixed Among City's Immigrants

body: The New York City man who contracted inhalation anthrax after working with untreated animal hides remained in serious condition yesterday, as the authorities awaited results of laboratory tests from the Crown Heights, Brooklyn, home of one of the man's colleagues. The man, Vado Diomande, a 44-year-old drummer and dancer, is believed to have inhaled
title: City Officials Await Anthrax Tests Results

body: The Greenwich Village home of a man infected with inhalation anthrax after working with unprocessed animal skins tested positive for the deadly germ, city officials said yesterday. Tests on the van and workplace used by the man, Vado Diomande, also tested positive for traces of anthrax. At the same time, Mr. Diomande's health worsened. Officials at
title: Anthrax Traces Found at 3 Sites as Victim Worsens
